page.title: 06The Terril.
page.content:
On the{farm at the Terril}there are forty Friesian cows and a Hereford bull. Twenty years ago when they were driving the cows up the road they used to have two cars following but now there are about two dozen. The farmer also over-winters Welsh lambs.
There are{two tied cottages}but only one is in use. A cottage had two rooms upstairs and only one room down- stairs. There are also{three other {houses}about l30 years old, these are now being extended.
The{five young children}from the cottages go to Crudgington School and the{four teenagers}go to the Charlton in Wellington.
